definition: a steady advance, lie adjacent to another or share a boundary
details:
noun
- a steady advance
= example: a steady advance
- the act of marching
= synonyms: marching
- genre of music written for marching
= example: genre of music written for marching
= synonyms: marching music
- a procession of people walking together
= example: a procession of people walking together
- district consisting of the area on either side of a border or boundary of a country or an area
= example: district consisting of the area on either side of a border or boundary of a country or an area
= synonyms: borderland, border district, marchland
verb
- lie adjacent to another or share a boundary
= synonyms: border, butt, edge, adjoin, butt against, abut, butt on
- walk fast, with regular or measured steps
- walk ostentatiously
= synonyms: exhibit, parade
- march in a procession
= synonyms: process
- force to march
= example: force to march
- cause to march or go at a marching pace
= example: cause to march or go at a marching pace
- march in protest
= synonyms: demonstrate
